scenarioDescription:
The psi 1 Dra B Exoplanetary System


Overview

psi 1 Dra B is a star with 1.19 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 74.10 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

psi 1 Dra B is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the psi 1 Dra B system


psi 1 Dra B b

psi 1 Dra B b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2016-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 4.43 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of psi 1 Dra B b is 486.540 times the mass of Earth. The radius of psi 1 Dra B b is 13.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, psi 1 Dra B b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system psi 1 Dra B, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: psi 1 Dra B - System With 1 Exoplanet
